episodeTitle: Huge Duel! The Giants Dorry and Broggy!
episodeTitleJapanese: でっかい決闘！巨人ドリーとブロギー
episodeTitleRomanized: Dekkai Kettō! Kyojin Dorī to Burogī
description: The Straw Hats split up on Little Garden and encounter two massive giants. Nami and Usopp meet Brogy while Luffy and Vivi encounter Dorry, learning about their century-long duel and the legendary land of Elbaph.

events.title: Brogy's First Appearance
events.description: Nami and Usopp encounter the giant Brogy crashing through the jungle on Little Garden. After being bitten by a Tyrannosaurus Rex, Brogy defeats it and introduces himself as the strongest warrior of Elbaph.
events.significance: Introduction of one of the two legendary giant captains and the first mention of Elbaph, the land of giants, which becomes increasingly important throughout the series.

quotes.text: I am Brogy! The strongest warrior of Elbaph!
quotes.speaker: Brogy
quotes.context: Brogy introduces himself to Nami and Usopp after defeating the T. rex

events.title: Brogy Defeats the Tyrannosaurus Rex
events.description: Brogy gets bitten from behind by a massive T. rex but quickly defeats it by chopping off its head with his axe, demonstrating the overwhelming strength of Elbaf's giants.
events.significance: Establishes the incredible physical power of the giants and shows why they were legendary pirates with high bounties.

events.title: First Mention of Elbaph in the Anime
events.description: Brogy mentions Elbaph for the first time in the anime, identifying himself as a warrior from the legendary land of giants. This is the anime's introduction to a location that becomes crucial to the overall story.
events.significance: Elbaph is established as the homeland of the giants and becomes a major location referenced throughout the series, eventually becoming the setting for a major arc over 20 years later in the story.

quotes.text: I am the strongest warrior of Elbaph!
quotes.speaker: Brogy
quotes.context: First mention of the giant homeland Elbaph

events.title: Nami and Usopp Play Dead
events.description: Frightened by Brogy's immense size and power, Nami and Usopp attempt to play dead when he invites them to be his guests, showing their comedic cowardice.
events.significance: A comedic moment that establishes the intimidating nature of the giants while also showcasing Nami and Usopp's characteristically fearful reactions.

events.title: Dorry's First Appearance
events.description: Luffy and Vivi encounter Dorry, the Blue Ogre, another giant who also claims to be the strongest warrior of Elbaph. Unlike Brogy's aggressive entrance, Dorry greets them more peacefully.
events.significance: Introduction of the second legendary giant captain, establishing the parallel structure of the episode and setting up the revelation of their rivalry.

quotes.text: I am Dorry, the strongest warrior of Elbaph!
quotes.speaker: Dorry
quotes.context: Dorry introduces himself to Luffy and Vivi

events.title: The Century-Long Duel Revealed
events.description: Dorry and Brogy explain to their respective guests that they have been fighting each other for 100 years on Little Garden. The duel resumes whenever the island's volcano erupts, which happens every hour.
events.significance: Establishes the central conflict of the Little Garden arc and demonstrates the giants' incredible honor code and dedication to their warrior traditions.

events.title: The Origin of Dorry and Brogy's Duel
events.description: The giants reveal they forgot the original reason for their duel, but continue fighting to determine who is right. Their battle has lasted a century with neither side gaining a clear advantage.
events.significance: Shows the absurdity yet honor-bound nature of giant culture, where a fight continues even when the reason is forgotten, demonstrating their unwavering commitment to resolving disputes through combat.

events.title: Dorry and Brogy Were Co-Captains
events.description: It's revealed that despite their century-long duel, Dorry and Brogy were once co-captains of the legendary Giant Warrior Pirates, suggesting they were originally best friends and allies.
events.significance: Adds depth to their relationship and establishes the Giant Warrior Pirates as a legendary crew from the past, while showing that their duel is between friends rather than enemies.

events.title: The Giants' Legendary Bounties
events.description: Mr. 3 and his team discuss capturing the giants for their bounties of 100,000,000 berries each, bounties that were set a century ago and remain unclaimed due to the giants' strength.
events.significance: Establishes the historical significance of Dorry and Brogy as legendary pirates and sets up the conflict with Baroque Works agents who want to claim their bounties.

events.title: Baroque Works Agents Plan to Capture the Giants
events.description: Mr. 3, Miss Goldenweek, Mr. 5, and Miss Valentine join forces and plot to earn the giants' huge bounties by exploiting their duel, setting up the arc's main conflict.
events.significance: Establishes the antagonistic force for the Little Garden arc and creates tension as the Baroque Works agents plan to interfere with the giants' honorable duel.

quotes.text: I am Brogy! The strongest warrior of Elbaph!
quotes.speaker: Brogy
quotes.context: Brogy's introduction to Nami and Usopp

quotes.text: I am Dorry, the strongest warrior of Elbaph!
quotes.speaker: Dorry
quotes.context: Dorry's introduction to Luffy and Vivi

themes.description: The episode explores the giants' unwavering commitment to their warrior code, fighting a century-long duel to determine who is right even though they've forgotten the original cause.
themes.symbolism: The hourly volcano eruption represents the regularity and inevitability of their honor-bound conflict.

themes.description: Dorry and Brogy's relationship mirrors other friendships in the series where rivalry coexists with deep respect and camaraderie.
themes.symbolism: The parallel meetings with Luffy's group and Nami's group mirror the dual nature of the giants' relationship.

themes.description: The episode emphasizes how Little Garden is a 'garden' to the giants but a dangerous jungle to normal-sized humans, playing with perspective and scale.
themes.symbolism: The prehistoric island serves as a playground for ancient warriors while being deadly to the Straw Hats.

characterSpotlights.development: Brogy is introduced as a massive, powerful giant with a jovial personality despite his fearsome appearance. He demonstrates both incredible strength and hospitality.
keyActions: Crashes through the jungle pursuing prey
Defeats a Tyrannosaurus Rex with one strike
Introduces himself as the strongest warrior of Elbaph
Offers hospitality to Nami and Usopp
quotes: I am Brogy! The strongest warrior of Elbaph!

characterSpotlights.development: Dorry is introduced as Brogy's rival and fellow giant captain. He appears slightly more composed and explains the nature of their century-long duel to Luffy and Vivi.
keyActions: Introduces himself as strongest warrior of Elbaph
Explains the century-long duel with Brogy
Reveals their forgotten reason for fighting
quotes: I am Dorry, the strongest warrior of Elbaph!

characterSpotlights.development: Nami demonstrates her typical fear when confronted with the unknown, but also her survival instincts.
Usopp shares Nami's fear but also shows curiosity about the giants' warrior culture, which resonates with his own aspirations.
keyActions: Witnesses Brogy defeat the T. rex
Begins to admire the giants' warrior spirit

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows his typical enthusiasm and fascination with strong warriors, immediately taking a liking to Dorry.
keyActions: Shows respect for their warrior code

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the scenes with the Brachiosaurus and other dinosaur encounters on the island.
The anime added scenes of Sanji and Zoro having a hunting competition to provide more content and comedic relief.

trivia.fact: Episode 71 marks the first mention of Elbaph in the One Piece anime, a location that wouldn't be visited until over 1000 episodes later in the series.
Dorry and Brogy's bounties of 100,000,000 berries each were considered extraordinarily high for their time, a century before the main story.
The episode covers parts of both Chapter 116 and Chapter 118 of the manga, with additional anime-original content.
This episode achieved a 14.7% TV rating in Japan, ranking 3rd for its time slot.
Daisuke Gōri, the original Japanese voice actor for Dorry, voiced the character from episodes 71-270 before being replaced due to his passing in 2010.
